On Mon, 24 May 2004 13:56:40 -0700 (PDT), Karl Lewin
<lewinke67@...> wrote:
> I'm working on a python implementation but I don't get
> as much time to work on it as I'd like.  My ultimate
> goal is to explore NEAT and co-evolution as applied to
> Texas Hold'em.  No dreams of a super player but it
> combines two interests of mine.

Hi Karl.  Have you read any of Watson and Noble's work on Pareto
Coevolution applied to Texas Hold 'Em?  Or looked at Aaron Davidson
and Darse Billings' stuff?

Philip and I are also interested in applying coevolved neural networks
to Texas Hold 'Em.  We've got a working implementation of NEAT in
Java, and a fair amount of the framework for evolving Hold 'Em
players.

We're focusing pretty heavily on getting our code released before the
GECCO conference next month, and then our primary focus will shift to
Gomoku, but we're still interested in a variety of domains, including
incomplete information ones such as Poker.  So if you want to talk
theory or practice regarding Texas Hold 'Em, coevolution, etc., let me
know.

Derek
